extra_info: percentage = DIVIDE(COUNT(raceId) where surname = 'Hamilton' and position>1), (COUNT(raceId) where surname = 'Hamilton'); since 2010 refers to year >= 2010
reasoning: Since 2010, Hamilton had 150 race results, of which 83 had position > 1 (outside first place). This gives a percentage of approximately 55% (83/150), not 26% as the claim states.

CREATE TABLE results
(

        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,

(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,

    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),

);

    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,

    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "
SELECT 
  COUNT(r.raceId) as total_races,
  SUM(CASE WHEN r.position > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as outside_first,
  ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN r.position > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(r.raceId), 0) as pct_outside_first
FROM results r
JOIN drivers d ON r.driverId = d.driverId
JOIN races ra ON r.raceId = ra.raceId
WHERE d.surname = 'Hamilton' AND ra.year >= 2010;
"

content.thinking:
So the total races for Hamilton since 2010 is 150, and 83 were outside first place (position > 1), which is 55%, not 26%. But wait - the hint says "position > 1" but the position field can be NULL (for DNFs etc.). Let me check more carefully.

Actually, looking at the hint again: percentage = DIVIDE(COUNT(raceId) where position>1, COUNT(raceId) where surname = 'Hamilton'). So it's counting races where position > 1 divided by total races. Let me check if NULL positions are being excluded or included.

Let me also check how many had position = 1.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "
SELECT 
  COUNT(r.raceId) as total_races,
  SUM(CASE WHEN r.position = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as first_place,
  SUM(CASE WHEN r.position > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as outside_first,
  SUM(CASE WHEN r.position IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as null_position,
  ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN r.position > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(r.raceId), 0) as pct_outside_first
FROM results r
JOIN drivers d ON r.driverId = d.driverId
JOIN races ra ON r.raceId = ra.raceId
WHERE d.surname = 'Hamilton' AND ra.year >= 2010;
"

content.thinking:
So since 2010:
- Total races: 150
- First place finishes: 49
- Outside first (position > 1): 83
- NULL position (DNF/retired): 18
- Percentage outside first: 83/150 = 55%

The claim says 26%, but the data shows 55%. That's clearly contradicted.

Wait, let me reconsider. Maybe the claim is about 26% being outside first place among races where he had a recorded position (non-NULL)? 83 / (49 + 83) = 83/132 = 62.9%. Still not 26%.
 
No matter how I interpret it—whether it's 55% of all races or 63% of recorded finishes—the claim that only 26% were outside first place doesn't hold up. The data directly contradicts this.

content.text:
The data shows that since 2010, Lewis Hamilton had 150 total race entries, with 83 having a position > 1 (outside first place). That gives 83/150 = ~55%, not 26%.
